description: SINGLE STOREY WRAP AROUND EXTENSION TO SIDE AND REAR.
decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The proposed single storey side and rear extension, by reason of design, position, scale, bulk and materials, would be unduly prominent, visually dominant and intrusive, detracting from the appearance, design, bulk, scale and proportions of the host dwelling and would fail to relate positively and appropriately to the siting, scale, proportions, height and massing of surrounding buildings, existing street patterns and the character and quality of the public realm and as such would be harmful to the character of Finborough Road. The proposals would be contrary to policy CS.14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).
Reason : 2 - The proposed single storey side and rear extension, by reason of the design, position, bulk and massing, represents an unneighbourly form of development that would be unduly prominent, visually dominant and intrusive resulting in a sense of enclosure and a loss of light and outlook to the detriment of the amenity of neighbouring occupiers. The proposals would be contrary to London Plan policy D3, policy CS.14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and policy DM D2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
